task.title: Share Screen on Microsoft Teams
task.shortdesc: While in a Microsoft Teams meeting, users can present content by sharing their screen or entire desktop.

taskbody.prereq: You must have a Microsoft account to use Teams. Screen sharing is available in both the web and app versions of Teams, on a desktop computer or mobile device.

info.note: It is recommended you use the desktop version of Teams to share your screen.

step.cmd: Click the button in the upper-right corner of the screen showing an upward facing arrow inside a square.
Click share Tab, Window or Entire Screen.

info.note: Sharing your tab will allow meeting participants to view the tab currently open on your browser. Sharing your window allows participants to view a specific window or application. All other information on the computer screen will not be shared. Sharing the entire screen allows participants to view your entire screen.

step.cmd: Check that there is a red outline around the presentation screen.

info.note: Users will also see a red outline around the screen indicating that you are sharing content with those on the Teams meeting.

step.cmd: Click the Stop Sharing button to stop sharing your screen.
Click the Audio Sharing button from the presenter toolbar.

info.note: Users can also share computer sound while screen sharing. The presenter toolbar contains user controls and is only visible to the person presenting.
